parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.
Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven. Of Hebrew origin; Sion, a hill of Jerusalem; figuratively, the Church.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A colt, young ass, foal. Apparently a primary word; a 'foal' or 'filly', i.e., a young ass.
A donkey. Apparently a primary word; a donkey.
